body.para:
-NOTE-Updated.
-NOTE- 1. For Hydraulics, only use ports 1 to 8. 2. For Pneumatics, can use ports 1 to 12.

para.text: 1. For Hydraulics, only use ports 1 to 8.
2. For Pneumatics, can use ports 1 to 12.
3. The cutting oil and hydraulic ports cannot be adjacent to each other. Adjacent usage can result in an oil
4. When using different fluids adjacent to each other, it is recommended that an empty port (drain) be
provided between the ports to prevent oil leaks. In this case, the number of available ports will be less
5. Lids for covering the hydraulic/pneumatic supply ports on the table top surface and O-rings (P8) for
sealing the port holes are provided as shipping. If a jig will be mounted, be sure to attach the O-ring
(P8) before mounting. Otherwise, an oil leak could occur.

para.style: text-align:center; margin-bottom:10px;
